title: Mission Description
content: You remember "Elder" Amunet as well asAidonia, this city-state that worshipedThanatos. This is where your memory begins.Of course, you also remember how you became an executioner and a Maiden of War.

speaker: Castorice
line: I... I can't do it.

speaker: Castorice
line: Their voices... They pierce my ears... The pleading, the thanks...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Ahh. I know that feeling, child. I was once as lost as you are now.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: But you must respect those walking towards death, just like how you should respect yourself as the Holy Maiden granting humans glory and liberation.

speaker: Castorice
line: What you're asking me to do is no better than the task of an executioner, and yet you want me to respect myself?

speaker: Castorice
line: No matter the titles, I am still taking away human lives...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: This won't be the first time that Aidonia's fanatical netherwarriors have faced death. On the contrary, recruits new to the battlefield often run away from their first fight.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Death is the mightiest and gravest power in this world. The fact that you can wield it means you are deserving of respect.

speaker: Castorice
line: That's such a... twisted reason...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: ...Then, let me tell you a story.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: In Aidonia, the greatswords commonly used by executioners are called "Drakonian" in memory of Drakon, an elderly executioner.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: The sword has three air holes along its body. If the sword is swung down swiftly and accurately, the holes would make no sound, and the executed would also depart this world quickly and painlessly...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: But should the executioner have any hesitation, the holes will produce a piercing whistle. On that cue, the screams of the executed are sure to follow.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Every executioner after Drakon is to hone their sword skills every day in preparation of future executions. Every swing of their blade must be more resolute than the last, for failing to do so will bring pain.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Pain for the dying... as well as pain for themselves.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...No. I can never get used to this.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: You misunderstand, child. I am not telling you to get used to it.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: I'm asking you to consider the source of the dead's suffering, and use that knowledge to fortify your future touches with more and more determination.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Go walk with the dead, and love them as you love life... Then you'll no longer hear those noises.

speaker: Unknown Death-Row Prisoner
line: Please... Don't kill me... I don't want to die....

children.speaker: "Elder" Amunet
children.line: This is your duty. Remember, consider the source of the dead's suffering, then give them the respect they deserve.

children.speaker: Unknown Death-Row Prisoner
children.line: Th—Thank you... I beg you... Don't listen to her...

children.speaker: "Elder" Amunet
children.line: If you cannot learn to accept death, then Aidonia has no place for you.

children.speaker: "Elder" Amunet
children.line: This is your last chance. Do it.

children.speaker: Unknown Death-Row Prisoner
children.line: No, please... I don't want to die... Please, I'm begging you...

speaker: Unknown Death-Row Prisoner
line: No... No...

text: You gently touch the prisoner's forehead with your finger. His face is pale, his eyes flicker with fear, and his body trembles uncontrollably.

speaker: merciful Touch of Death
line: Is it because of fear, anger, and hatred, or is your so-called simply a lie?

text: The dark purple mottles spread like petals across the death row inmate's face, then seemed to be submerged by springwater, flooding his body. His trembling ceased, and the cries that had once begged for mercy slowly turned into a sigh-like whimper, as he murmurs to himself.
Quickly, everything falls into a dead silence, turning into pitch-black dew that scatters with the wind. You hear your own heartbeat drown out the sound of heavy breathing.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: May you gain some insights through his sacrifice.

speaker: Castorice
line: Is... this all?

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: No. Come with me.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: This is just the beginning of your life as the Maiden of War.

speaker: Courageous Warrior
line: H-Holy Maiden...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Go. Grant her glorious death.

speaker: Courageous Warrior
line: Th—Thank... you...

speaker: Outlander War Captive
line: Do it then! Executioner...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: You heard him.

speaker: Outlander War Captive
line: I curse you... to live in eternal pain...!

speaker: Ill Herder
line: Please... grant me release...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: You know what to do.

text: Speak with "Elder" Amunet and learn about the duties of an executioner

title: Step Description
content: You remember "Elder" Amunet as well as Aidonia, the city-state that worshiped Thanatos. This is where your memory begins.The "Elder" does not wish that you become a merciless executioner, but that you would fully understand the weight of life and death, then carry out with utmost respect the duty with which you were born.

speaker: Castorice
line: When will this ever end...?

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Come. Fulfill your duty.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...What?

speaker: Castorice
line: ...What are you trying to do with me?

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: I have aged... The time has come for me to heed the summons of Thanatos and journey to their domain.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: ...The final resting place of every Aidonian.

speaker: Castorice
line: You're not that old yet... You still have many, many years ahead of you...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: No no... I'm already "dead."

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: For I have come to fear... my declining health and impending death.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Castorice, will you give me one last chance to charge towards fear and prove that I am no coward?

speaker: Castorice
line: I... I can't take this anymore...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Child, it was I who brought you here from the frosty plains and set your farcical fate in motion. It was also I, chief executioner of Aidonia, who forced the heavy duty of executing others onto you.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: I've always known... that you have doubts and even anger about my faith... and about me...

speaker: Castorice
line: I... never had a choice...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Indeed. We essentially abducted you.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Yet you can end any sinful life with just a touch of your fingers... Shouldn't it be easy for you escape from here?

speaker: Castorice
line: ...I'll never do that.

speaker: Castorice
line: It doesn't matter how lightly the Aidonians take death, or how readily they accept it... I simply can't do it.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Haha... I knew I was right about you.

speaker: Castorice
line: Wh—What do you mean?

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: I've taught you and cared for you as my own daughter all this time... because of this blessing that's been with you since your birth. I know no one else in the world would understand the weight of life and death more than you do.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: In the eyes of an Aidonian, "Death" is the end of all life, a destination we will all eventually reach. Humans should not resist it, but learn how to face it.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: You can only live your life to the fullest after understanding this principle.

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: And when you do, even if you eventually leave Aidonia's protection... even if you must carry the curse forever... you can live with your head held high, like everyone else.

speaker: Castorice
line: No, how can I—

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Come now. It's time. I have already taught you all that I know...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Show me that you are a fitting Holy Maiden... or at least, that you possess the resolve to become one.

title: Step Description
content: You remember "Elder" Amunet as well as Aidonia, this city-state that worshiped Thanatos. This is where your memory begins.Actively use your natural-born talent and learn to accept it."Prove that you're a capable Holy Maiden, or that you have such resolve."

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Come now. It's time. I have already taught you all that I know...

speaker: "Elder" Amunet
line: Show me that you are a fitting Holy Maiden... or at least, that you possess the resolve to become one.

text: "The galaxy is vast beyond compare, containing an infinite number of possibilities." Our community needs more information on this page! Can you help out? Click here to add more. The reason provided was: Missing Animation

speaker: Castorice
line: This was the last time I followed her command. I gently touched the elderly woman before me.

speaker: Castorice
line: The executioner who had seen too much death died the same way as everyone else... A gasp for air, a wistful look in her eyes, and a barely perceptible tremor in her fingertips.

speaker: Castorice
line: Elder Amunet, the person who tried to teach me about "Death," ultimately vanished like dew in the morning mist. She spent her life embodying the beliefs of the Aidonians, and when death finally came, she embraced it exactly as their doctrine had taught...

speaker: Castorice
line: I have nothing but respect for her.

speaker: Castorice
line: I erected a cenotaph in her honor in the marshes outside Aidonia's city walls with the others I had laid to rest. Then, I set out once more in search of Thanatos .

speaker: Castorice
line: It was a long, long journey... I heard so many discussions about death along the way. "Life finds meaning in death." "The world improves because there is an end"...

speaker: Castorice
line: It seems the most terrible darkness in this world. Everyone talks about its heavy weight. Some resist it, some worship it, and some even revere it...

speaker: Castorice
line: How did a disappeared Titan become the deepest fear of humankind...

speaker: Castorice
line: ...And why do they haunt my dreams?

speaker: Castorice
line: I continued my travels to seek an answer. Initially, I was running away. Then, I started searching for it. And now, at the end...

speaker: Castorice
line: I just want to know if my touch... if my embrace... can do more than taking things away...

speaker: Castorice
line: Can I make anything...? Can I leave anything behind?

children.speaker: Inmate
children.line: I don't want to die, please.

children.speaker: Inmate
children.line: I don't want mercy like this!

children.speaker: Inmate
children.line: Just... let me go... I need them...I don't...

children.speaker: "Elder" Amunet
children.line: The Reaper has blessed your hands.

children.speaker: "Elder" Amunet
children.line: Only you can grant them peace.

children.speaker: Old Woman
children.line: Watching people leave this world again and again...

children.speaker: Old Woman
children.line: You must want to desperately embrace them

children.speaker: Old Woman
children.line: So go on, don't hold back,

text: "The galaxy is vast beyond compare, containing an infinite number of possibilities." Our community needs more information on this page! Can you help out? Click here to add more. The reason provided was: Missing Animation (same as the sad face version in Spindle, Laboring to Weave the Tapestry of Time )

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ On the day that Oronyx's Trial ended, you must have had many questions, ( Trailblazer ).

speaker: Castorice
line: I felt just as confused. Why, as someone from beyond the sky, were you so cruelly dragged into Amphoreus 's fate?

speaker: Castorice
line: ...I wished I could take action, but no matter how hard I try, I cannot simply interact with the living as ordinary people do.

speaker: Castorice
line: Even when we brushed against each other unintentionally in the Grove... and it was obvious that nothing had happened...

text: "The galaxy is vast beyond compare, containing an infinite number of possibilities." Our community needs more information on this page! Can you help out? Click here to add more. The reason provided was: Missing Animation (same as the surprise face version in Spindle, Laboring to Weave the Tapestry of Time )

speaker: Castorice
line: When an almost unattainable hope finally welled up in my heart...

speaker: Castorice
line: When I thought that perhaps my touch would no longer bring sorrow...

speaker: Castorice
line: Fate declared to me: It wasn't that the curse of "Death" had finally been lifted...

speaker: Castorice
line: ...but that your soul no longer belonged to this world... and there was nothing left for my hands to take. Nothing.

speaker: Castorice
line: And did I really think this time would be any different? It's not that I don't understand this reality — just that I'm unwilling to accept it.

speaker: Castorice
line: Having walked such a long road, I am still unable to find the answer to life and death. I am resigned to eternal despair...

speaker: Castorice
line: Anything I wish to hold on to, "Death" will inevitably wrest from my grasp...

speaker: Castorice
line: And from that moment on, I lacked the courage to confirm it again... Until Oronyx laid bare the cruel truth before us.
